Good Comments: The subtitles sUcKz. UGLY! The rest is acceptable. This anime have better subs making it.

Good subs, although at times skipped, but altogether ok. Not their best work, but it passes.
Subs not all that great. Used far harsher language than the characters such as "horny" and "bitch" when the Japanese wasn't anywhere near that offensive.
Bad Comments: Good subbing albeit some inaccuracies.

Although there were some mistakes, the worst part was the tone. They frequently drop to profanity when the actual dialogue is much less intense. It is unnecessary and frequently misrepresents the characters.

Mistranslations everywhere. Usually they're not that big of a deal, but sometimes they completely ruin scenes by leaving out details that would explain a joke, or they leave something totally untranslated.
Good subbing

Terrible fan-subbers. They translate non-rude words into rude words, making chiaki sound like an asshole. Especially when Chiaki called Nodame a "bitch" something was clearly wrong. Even though Chiaki refers to himself as 俺様(ore-sama）he wasn't THAT
Enough of their work has been seen to say... they make good timings and subs look easy. A   Peeps :D

Good Comments: The show aired in Spring 2003 -- there's a limit to how good this TV-rip could've looked. But great subs from fansubbers at the top of their game.
